# Toolbar API

<p className="description">The API documentation of the Toolbar React component. Learn more about the props and the CSS customization points.</p>

## Import

```js
import Toolbar from '@material-ui/core/Toolbar';
// or
import { Toolbar } from '@material-ui/core';
```

You can learn more about the difference by [reading this guide](/guides/minimizing-bundle-size/).



## Props

| Name | Type | Default | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| <span className="prop-name">children</span> | <span className="prop-type">node</span> |  | Toolbar children, usually a mixture of `IconButton`, `Button` and `Typography`. |
| <span className="prop-name">classes</span> | <span className="prop-type">object</span> |  | Override or extend the styles applied to the component. See [CSS API](#css) below for more details. |
| <span className="prop-name">component</span> | <span className="prop-type">elementType</span> | <span className="prop-default">'div'</span> | The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a DOM element or a component. |
| <span className="prop-name">disableGutters</span> | <span className="prop-type">bool</span> | <span className="prop-default">false</span> | If `true`, disables gutter padding. |
| <span className="prop-name">variant</span> | <span className="prop-type">'regular'<br />&#124;&nbsp;'dense'</span> | <span className="prop-default">'regular'</span> | The variant to use. |

The `ref` is forwarded to the root element.

Any other props supplied will be provided to the root element (native element).

## CSS

- Style sheet name: `MuiToolbar`.
- Style sheet details:

| Rule name | Global class | Description |
|:-----|:-------------|:------------|
| <span className="prop-name">root</span> | <span className="prop-name">MuiToolbar-root</span> | Styles applied to the root element.
| <span className="prop-name">gutters</span> | <span className="prop-name">MuiToolbar-gutters</span> | Styles applied to the root element if `disableGutters={false}`.
| <span className="prop-name">regular</span> | <span className="prop-name">MuiToolbar-regular</span> | Styles applied to the root element if `variant="regular"`.
| <span className="prop-name">dense</span> | <span className="prop-name">MuiToolbar-dense</span> | Styles applied to the root element if `variant="dense"`.

You can override the style of the component thanks to one of these customization points:

- With a rule name of the [`classes` object prop](/customization/components/#overriding-styles-with-classes).
- With a [global class name](/customization/components/#overriding-styles-with-global-class-names).
- With a theme and an [`overrides` property](/customization/globals/#css).

If that's not sufficient, you can check the [implementation of the component](https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/blob/master/packages/material-ui/src/Toolbar/Toolbar.js) for more detail.

## Demos
